recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place dark chocolate, cocoa powder, and salt in top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted and smooth, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix sugar and milk powder together in a small bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Place 1 3/4 cups milk and cream in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, whisking occasionally, until mixture comes to a full rolling boil. Whisk the sugar mixture into the pot. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes, whisking to prevent scorching. Remove from heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix 2 tablespoons milk and tapioca together into a small bowl. Whisk into the hot dairy mixture."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk 1/3 of the dairy mixture into the bowl of melted chocolate. Repeat twice more, whisking well until smooth. Let cool to room temperature, about 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Strain mixture into a bowl and refrigerate for 4 hours, or preferably overnight. Make caramelized almonds and toasted marshmallows before churning the ice cream."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with silicone baking mats."},{"recipe_directions":"Toast almonds in a dry skillet over medium heat until fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl. Pour onto a baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling, 7 to 8 minutes. Let cool completely before breaking up into uneven pieces."},{"recipe_directions":"While almonds are cooling, spread marshmallows out on the second baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until tops are lightly toasted, about 5 minutes. Let cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Churn ice cream according to manufacturer's instructions until it reaches a soft-serve consistency, about 20 minutes. recipe_card: Brownie Baked Alaska
recipe_tags: [{"recipe_tags":"Frozen Dessert Recipes"},{"recipe_tags":"Ice Cream"},{"recipe_tags":"Chocolate Ice Cream Recipes"}]
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1  serving cooking spray"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ sticks unsalted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (6 ounce) bag semisweet chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1 ounce) square unsweetened chocolate, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ tablespoon instant coffee granules"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 pints pistachio ice cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 pints strawberry ice cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  egg whites, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup superfine sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon vanilla extract"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees (175 degrees C). Line the bottom of a 9-inch cake pan with parchment and spray the sides with cooking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Melt butter, semisweet chocolate chips, and unsweetened chocolate in a medium mixing bowl set over a double boiler, stirring frequently. Remove from heat and let cool while working on the next step."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a small mixing bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk sugar, eggs, instant coffee, and vanilla together in another bowl until well combined. Pour in the chocolate mixture and stir to combine. Add in the flour mixture and stir until fully incorporated. Pour batter into the cake pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until edges are set and a toothpick inserted into the middle comes out clean, about 35 minutes. Cool completely in the pan, at least 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"In the meantime, transfer ice cream to the refrigerator to warm for 15 minutes. Line a 9-inch glass mixing bowl with plastic wrap, leaving a few inches of overhang on the sides."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove one of the pints of pistachio ice cream and press into the bottom of the prepared bowl using a small rubber spatula. Smooth into an even layer and freeze for 15 minutes. Repeat the process with both pints of strawberry ice cream, freezing for 15 minutes between each pint."},{"recipe_directions":"Fold the overhanging plastic wrap over the top layer of ice cream. Freeze until solid, 10 hours to overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Turn brownie out, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Gently whisk egg whites with superfine sugar and cream of tartar over top of a double boiler until eggs are warm to the touch the sugar has dissolved, about 5 minutes. Pour meringue into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. Whip at a low speed until foamy. Increase speed and beat until stiff, glossy peaks form, 5 to 6 minutes. Stir in vanilla."},{"recipe_directions":"Unwrap chilled brownie and place on a serving tray or cake stand. Grab the plastic wrap overhang and lift the ice cream dome out of the bowl, dunking the bottom of the bowl in warm water to help it release. Place dome flat-side down on top of the brownie."},{"recipe_directions":"Quickly frost the dome with the meringue in a swirl pattern, covering the ice cream completely."},{"recipe_directions":"Toast the meringue using a brulee torch, or broil until browned. Serve immediately."}]

recipe_card: Chocolate Hazelnut Tartufo 9 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups whole milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  egg yolks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup chocolate-hazelnut spread (such as Nutella®)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons instant espresso powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ounces fine quality bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8  maraschino cherries"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup frozen whipped topping, thawed"}]

Remove from heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Add the chocolate hazelnut spread, espresso powder, and vanilla, stirring until well combined. Pour through a mesh strainer into a bowl. Transfer gelato into an airtight container and place in freezer until solid."},{"recipe_directions":"To make the tartufo: Scoop 4-ounce portions of gelato and form into balls using your hands. recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Gently mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt with a fork in a bowl. Beat the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next. Beat in the vanilla with the last egg. Mix in the flour mixture until just incorporated. Fold in the chocolate chips; mixing just enough to evenly combine."},{"recipe_directions":"Divide the dough into 24 3-tablespoon-sized balls. Flatten the balls to about 1/4-inch thick onto a baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the edges are golden, 15 to 17 minutes. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet until the centers begin to set, about 20 minutes."}]

Remove from baking sheets to cool on wire racks."}]

Stir in the chocolate chips."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer dough to a resealable plastic bag. Remove parchment and finish cooling the cookies on the rack."}]

Remove from oven and set aside to cool while you prepare cheesecake filling. Decrease oven temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine cream cheese and remaining 1 1/3 cups sugar in the bowl of an electric stand-mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat on medium-high speed until completely smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes, scraping down sides as necessary. Add melted chocolate and beat until incorporated, about 30 seconds. Add sour cream and beat until combined, about 30 seconds. Add coffee liqueur, Irish cream liqueur, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt; beat on medium until combined, about 1 minute. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat on low until just incorporated. Pour cheesecake mixture into the cooled crust. Place the springform pan into a large roasting pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Place roasting pan on center rack in the oven. Carefully pour boiling water into the roasting pan to come 1 inch up the sides of the springform pan, making sure you do not get any water into the cheesecake."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set but still slightly jiggly in the center, 60 to 65 minutes. Turn oven off and prop open door. Let cheesecake cool in oven for 1 hour. Remove roasting pan with cheesecake from oven. Remove cheesecake from roasting pan and set aside to cool completely, about 45 minutes. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 4 hours, up to overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Run a sharp paring knife around edges of crust to loosen from pan. Remove sides of springform pan. Run knife around bottom of cheesecake to loosen. Gently shimmy, or use large spatulas, to transfer cheesecake onto a cake stand or serving plate. Top with white chocolate curls. Slice and serve cold or at room temperature."}]

recipe_card: The Best Vanilla Bean Cheesecake 6 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2  Madagascar vanilla beans"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups graham cracker crumbs (such as Keebler)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup butter, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) container sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups heavy whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup confectioners' sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (4 ounce) bars white baking chocolate, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons confectioners' sugar"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Split 1 vanilla bean lengthwise with the tip of a sharp knife. Holding the pod open, scrape seeds from each half using the flat side of your knife; place in a bowl. Repeat with second vanilla bean, placing seeds in a separate bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and 1/4 white sugar together in a bowl. Press over the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch springform pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine 2 packages cream cheese, sour cream, 1 cup white sugar, and cornstarch in a large bowl; mix until sugar is dissolved. Add seeds from 1 vanilla bean, softened butter, and vanilla extract; blend until smooth. Pour over graham cracker crust."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until top is a light tan color, 30 to 35 minutes; set aside to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat 2 cups heavy cream in a chilled bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Add 1/4 confectioners' sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating until cream is stiff. Place in the refrigerator."},{"recipe_directions":"Melt white chocolate in top of a double boiler over simmering water, stirring frequently and scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching. Remove from heat and let cool, about 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat 1 package cream cheese with an electric mixer until fluffy. Beat in white chocolate until smooth. Fold in whipped cream. Spread over the cooled crust. Chill for 1 to 2 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat 1 cup heavy cream in a chilled bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Beat in seeds from the second vanilla bean and 1 1/2 tablespoon confectioners' sugar until stiff peaks form. Spread over cheesecake. Cover and refrigerate until firm, at least 6 hours to overnight."}]

recipe_card: Snickers Cheesecake 2 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"20  chocolate wafer cookies, finely ground"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup caramel chips, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chopped peanuts, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"16 mini chocolate-coated caramel-peanut nougat candy bars (such as Snickers®), divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (7 ounce) can whipped cream (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chocolate chips"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix ground cookies, butter, and 1 tablespoon sugar together in a bowl until combined. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan. Top crust with 1/4 cup caramel chips and 2 tablespoons chopped peanuts."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix cream cheese and 1 1/2 cups sugar together until smooth. Blend in milk. Mix in eggs 1 at a time; stir until just incorporated. Mix in sour cream, vanilla extract, and 2 tablespoons flour, using a wooden spoon, until batter is smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Chop 6 mini candy bars into small pieces; toss with 1 tablespoon flour in a bowl (to prevent sinking to bottom of cake). Stir into batter; pour into crust-lined pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Keep door closed. Turn off heat; let cake cool in the oven for at least 3 hours. Remove from oven; chill 8 hours to overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Release cake from pan; transfer to a serving plate. Decorate top edge of cake with whipped cream. Put remaining 1/4 cup caramel chips and 2 tablespoons chocolate chips in separate microwave-safe bowls; heat in the microwave until melted, about 1 minute. Drizzle melted caramel over cake; repeat with melted chocolate. Chop remaining candy bars and arrange on top of whipped cream. Sprinkle remaining 2 tablespoons peanuts on cake."}]

recipe_card: Orange Citrus Cheesecake 7 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"Reynolds Wrap® Heavy Duty Aluminum Foil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large orange"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¾ cups crushed vanilla wafers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup finely chopped pecans (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup butter, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  eggs, lightly beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ounces white baking chocolate, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup fresh cranberries, coarsely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons orange juice"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line the outside of a 9-inch springform pan with a double layer of 18-inch-wide Reynolds Wrap® Heavy Duty Aluminum Foil. Bring edges of the foil up and mold the foil around the sides of the springform pan to form a watertight seal outside of the pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Zest 1 teaspoon orange zest from the orange. Juice 1/4 cup orange juice from the orange set both aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine vanilla wafers, pecans (if using), and 1 tablespoon granulated sugar in a medium bowl. Stir in melted butter. Press the mixture onto the bottom and about 1 1/2 inches up the sides of the prepared springform pan. Place in a roasting pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat cream cheese, 3/4 cup granulated sugar, flour, and orange zest together in a large bowl using an electric mixer on low speed until combined. Add orange juice and beat until smooth. Beat in eggs and white chocolate."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour filling into crust-lined pan. Place roasting pan on the oven rack. Pour enough boiling water into roasting pan to reach halfway up the sides of the springform pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake 1 hour or until top is just set and edges jiggle slightly when pan is gently shaken. Turn oven off and allow cheesecake to stand in oven for 1 hour (it will continue to set up during standing time in oven)."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove springform pan from water bath and cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes. Using a small sharp knife, loosen the crust from sides of the springform pan cool for 30 minutes. Remove sides of springform pan cool cheesecake on wire rack for 2 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Cover and chill for at least 4 hours before serving. Top with Cranberry Orange Sauce to serve."},{"recipe_directions":"Cranberry Orange Sauce: Combine 1 cup fresh cranberries, coarsely chopped 1/4 cup granulated sugar and 2 tablespoons orange juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring frequently, until the sugar is dissolved and the cranberries start to break down. Remove from heat and cool completely before serving."}]

recipe_card: PHILLY Chocolate Turtles Cheesecake 15 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups finely chopped toasted pecans"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons non-hydrogenated margarine, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"32  KRAFT Caramels, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 (250 g) packages PHILADELPHIA Brick Cream Cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) package BAKERS Semi-Sweet Chocolate, melted, cooled slightly"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup pecan halves, toasted"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Cover bottom of 9 inch springform pan with parchment paper. Microwave caramels and milk in microwaveable bowl on MEDIUM 4 to 5 minutes or until caramels are completely melted and mixture is well blended, stirring every 2 minutes. Spread over crust to within 1 inch of edge; cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat cream cheese and remaining sugar with mixer until blended. Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended. Stir in chocolate; pour over caramel layer."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until centre is almost set. Run knife or metal spatula around rim of pan to loosen cake; cool before removing rim. Refrigerate 4 hours. Sprinkle with pecans halves just before serving."}]

Pour the batter over the cooled crust and smooth the top."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes, or until the center appears solid when jiggled slightly."}]

recipe_card: Red Velvet-Center Cheesecake 33 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ teaspoons baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons red food coloring"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ teaspoons distilled white vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup unsalted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup melted unsalted butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pint heavy whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9-inch cake pan. Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl; set aside. Stir the milk, food coloring, vinegar, and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract together in a small bowl; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat the softened butter and 3/4 cup sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy. The mixture should be noticeably lighter in color. Beat in the egg until smooth. Pour in the flour mixture alternately with the milk, mixing until just incorporated. Pour the batter into prepared pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack."},{"recipe_directions":"Once the cake has cooled, cut half of the cake into cubes, and set aside. Cut the remaining cake into 1/2-inch strips, and place onto a baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Return the cake strips to the oven, and bake until they have dried out, about 15 minutes. Turn the strips over halfway through cooking so they dry evenly. Once completely dry, allow to cool to room temperature, then crush into fine crumbs."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine the cake crumbs with the melted butter until evenly moistened. Press into a 10-inch springform pan, and refrigerate until the butter has hardened, about 45 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"When the crust has nearly hardened, whip the whipping cream until stiff; set aside. Beat the softened cream cheese in a bowl with 2/3 cup sugar and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract until smooth. Fold in the whipped cream until evenly mixed. Pour half of the cream cheese mixture into hardened crumb crust. Spread the cake cubes evenly over the cream cheese mixture, then spread the remaining cream cheese over top. Refrigerate at least 4 hours until the cream cheese has set and the cheesecake is firm."}]

Mix the gelatin into the warmed chocolate until melted; set aside to cool to room temperature. recipe_card: Master Recipe for Rich and Creamy Cheesecake 127 Ratings
recipe_name: Master Recipe for Rich and Creamy Cheesecake
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon softened butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons crumbs from Famous Chocolate Wafers, graham crackers or ginger snaps, OR"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (3 ounce) package soft ladyfingers (24 total) left whole, but trimmed to fit pan (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  large eggs, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"Heavy-duty foil for pan"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Adjust oven rack to middle position, and heat oven to 325 degrees. Brush interior of a 9-inch springform pan with butter. Add crumbs of choice and tilt pan in all directions to evenly coat, or line pan sides with ladyfingers. Tear off two long strips of heavy-duty foil, overlap in a cross pattern, and set the pan in the middle. Bring up sides, crimping around exterior top of the pan and forming a tight seal. Set it in a roasting pan large enough to hold it."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until smooth. Gradually add sugar and beat on medium speed until fully incorporated. Scrape down bowl sides and beat again until smooth. Add eggs, one at a time, scraping down bowl after each addition to ensure a creamy batter. Slowly beat in vanilla, then cream and sour cream. (Meanwhile, bring tea kettle of water to a boil, then turn off heat.)"},{"recipe_directions":"Pour batter into prepared pan. Set the roasting pan on oven rack and pour in enough boiling water to come halfway up the side of the springform pan. Bake until cake perimeter is set but center still jiggles, about 40 minutes (some flavor variations will take longer). Turn off heat and leave oven door ajar; let cheesecake sit in oven so the residual heat continues to cook it, about 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove pan from water; set on a wire rack. Let cool to room temperature. Cover and refrigerate until well-chilled, about 3 hours (can be refrigerated up to 4 days). Run a sharp knife around the edge of the pan, loosen the spring siding and serve."}]

Stir in the eggs one at a time, stopping and scraping down the sides of the bowl between each one."},{"recipe_directions":"Divide the mixture evenly into two separate bowls. recipe_card: Guinness and Chocolate Cheesecake 159 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup crushed chocolate cookies"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ pound semisweet chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup Irish stout beer (e.g. Guinness®)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1 ounce) square semisweet chocolate"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch springform pan with butter."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine the crushed cookies, butter, 2 tablespoons sugar, and cocoa in a small bowl; mix; press into the bottom of the prepared springform pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the cream cheese in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer set to low speed until smooth. While beating, slowly add 1 cup sugar and then the eggs, one at a time. Continue beating until smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine the chocolate chips and heavy cream in a microwave-safe bowl. Heat in the microwave until the chocolate is completely melted, stirring every 30 seconds. Beat the chocolate into the cream cheese mixture. Do not overbake."},{"recipe_directions":"While cake is baking, prepare a piece of parchment paper that is slightly larger than the baking pan. Sprinkle lightly with remaining cocoa powder."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove cake from the oven and run a knife around the edges of the pan to loosen the cake. Invert the cake quickly and carefully, as pan will be hot, onto the cocoa-sprinkled parchment paper. Remove the piece of parchment the cake baked on and discard. Working quickly, roll the cake and cocoa-sprinkled paper up together, starting from the narrow end. Set the cake seam-side down on a wire rack to cool completely, 1 to 2 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"While cake cools, finish the fillings. Remove the white and dark chocolate from the refrigerator. The white chocolate will be soft-set. Whip the white chocolate, beginning on low speed and working up to medium-high, until light and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes. Pour in remaining 3/4 cup of heavy cream, and beat on medium-high speed until mixture has the texture of whipped cream, 1 to 2 minutes. Place white chocolate whipped cream into a piping bag or zip-top bag with a 1/2-inch hole cut into a corner. Keep refrigerated until ready to use."},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare dark chocolate filling. The dark chocolate will be firm set. Whip the dark chocolate, starting on low speed and working up to medium speed, until mixture crumbles. Beat until the chocolate crumbles begin to become lighter in color and texture, 1 to 2 minutes. Add remaining 3/4 cup heavy cream and beat on medium-high speed until mixture is smooth, light, and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes. The dark chocolate mixture will be slightly thicker than the white chocolate. Add more heavy cream if necessary to achieve the desired \"lightness\" and consistency of whipped mousse. Place whipped dark chocolate mousse into a piping bag or zip-top bag with a 1/2-inch hole cut into a corner. Keep refrigerated until ready to use."},{"recipe_directions":"Unroll cooled cake gently and discard parchment paper. Pipe alternating stripes of white chocolate whipped cream and whipped dark chocolate mousse vertically along the 12-inch side of the cake, in stripes about 1/2-inch thick. Continue this vertical pattern along the entirety of the cake, leaving about a 1/2-inch border on all sides. Gently roll the cake back up over the filling (without the parchment) as tightly as possible without breaking the cake until the cake is completely rolled up. Place onto a serving platter and refrigerate until set, at least 1 hour."}]

Line the bottoms of three 8-inch cake pans with parchment paper and spray with baking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder in a large bowl and whisk until well combined. Add milk, vegetable oil, eggs, and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract to flour mixture and mix together using an electric mixer on medium speed until well combined. Reduce speed and carefully pour boiling water into cake batter. Beat on high speed for about 1 minute to add air to the batter. Distribute cake batter evenly between the prepared cake pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen. Invert cakes carefully onto serving plates or cooling racks. Let cool completely. Trim tops of cakes to level, if necessary."},{"recipe_directions":"Place 8 ounces chopped chocolate in the heatproof bowl of a stand mixer and set aside. Whisk together 3/4 cup cream and 1 tablespoon shortening in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and pour boiling mixture over chocolate and whisk until melted and smooth. Cool to room temperature. Beat using an electric mixer on high speed until chocolate mixture is lighter in color and fluffy in texture, about 1 minute. Immediately proceed to assemble the cake before the the whipped chocolate fudge filling hardens, which makes it difficult to spread."},{"recipe_directions":"To assemble the cake, place 1 cooled cake layer with the trimmed side up on a cake pan or serving plate. Spread 1/2 the whipped chocolate fudge filling evenly on top. Add the next layer and spread remaining chocolate fudge filling on top. Top with third layer, trimmed side down."},{"recipe_directions":"To prepare the buttercream frosting, use a stand mixer affixed with the paddle attachment. Beat together butter and confectioners' sugar on low speed until well blended. Add chocolate-hazelnut spread and increase the speed to medium. Beat for 2 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and kosher salt and whip for an additional 30 seconds. Add 2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream and beat until the frosting lightens slightly in color and texture, about 1 more minute."},{"recipe_directions":"Frost entire cake with buttercream frosting and chill for at least 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"For the chocolate drippys, place 4 ounces chopped chocolate in the heatproof bowl of a stand mixer and set aside. Whisk together 1/4 cup cream and 1/2 tablespoon shortening in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour boiling cream mixture over chocolate and whisk until melted and smooth. Let cool slightly, then pour mixture into a clean squeeze bottle. Let set until it has the consistency of thin ranch dressing. Squeeze on top of the frosted cake and allow to drip down the sides. Chill until chocolate is set. Decorate the top of the cake with assorted confections of your choice and serve at room temperature."}]

Remove from the oven and cool for at least 10 minutes before cutting into 2-inch squares."}]

recipe_card: Lava Cake 19 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"6 ½ (1 ounce) squares semisweet chocolate, finely chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup butter, cut into 8 pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  eggs, room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 teaspoons unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted, about 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine eggs and sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until pale and thick, about 5 minutes. Mix in melted chocolate, flour, cocoa powder, and a pinch of salt until combined. Pour batter into the prepared ramekins and place on a baking tray."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the sides are set but the middle is still jiggly, 10 to 13 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving."}]

recipe_card: Chocolate Scotcheroos 278 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"cooking spray"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup light corn syrup"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup peanut butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 cups Kellogg's Rice Krispies cereal"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup semisweet chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup butterscotch chips"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Make the bars: Combine corn syrup and sugar in 3-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until sugar dissolves and mixture begins to boil."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove from the heat and stir in peanut butter until well combined. Add rice cereal and stir until well coated. Press mixture into the prepared baking dish."},{"recipe_directions":"Make the topping: Melt chocolate and butterscotch chips in a 1-quart saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly. Spread evenly over cereal mixture. Let stand until firm, about 20 minutes. Cut into 24 bars."}]

recipe_card: Chef John's Chocolate Soufflé 107 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon melted butter, or as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ounces 70% dark chocolate, broken into pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 ½ tablespoons cold milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch cayenne pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg yolk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  large egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon white sugar, divided"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"Brush the bottom and sides (right up to the rim) of two 5-ounce ramekins lightly with 1 teaspoon melted butter. Add 1 tablespoon white sugar to each ramekin; rotate until sugar coats all surfaces, then tip to pour off extra sugar."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour 3 cups hot water into a pot set over low heat. Place chocolate pieces in a metal mixing bowl; place the bowl over the pot of water until chocolate melts; do not let the water simmer or boil."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, melt 1 tablespoon butter in a skillet over medium heat. Whisk in flour until incorporated and mixture thickens, about 1 minute. Reduce heat to low. Whisk in cold milk until mixture becomes smooth and thickens, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer milk mixture to the bowl with melted chocolate. Add salt andcayenne pepper and mix until thoroughly combined. Add egg yolk and mix to combine. Leave the bowl above the hot (not simmering) water to keep chocolate warm while you whip the egg whites."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk egg whites and cream of tartar in a mixing bowl until mixture begins to thicken; a drizzle from the whisk should stay on the surface for one second before disappearing into the mix."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk in 1/3 of the sugar for 15 seconds. Repeat two more times to whisk in remaining sugar. Continue to whisk until mixture holds soft peaks and has a consistency of shaving cream, 3 to 5 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer a little less than 1/2 of the egg white mixture to the chocolate mixture; mix until thoroughly incorporated, 1 to 2 minutes. Gently fold in remaining egg white mixture with a spatula until no white remains. Divide between the prepared ramekins and place on the lined baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in preheated oven until soufflés are puffed and have risen above the top of the rims, 12 to 15 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Buckeyes 797 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups peanut butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups sifted confectioners' sugar, or more as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups semisweet chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"toothpicks"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Beat peanut butter, butter, and vanilla together in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in 4 cups sifted confectioners' sugar until dough is stiff, firm, and dry with no lumps; you may need up to 2 cups more sifted confectioners' sugar."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll dough into about sixty 1-inch balls and place on wax-lined cookie sheets. Press a toothpick into the top of each ball and chill in the freezer until firm, about 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Place chocolate chips in a double boiler or in a bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water. Stir frequently until melted and smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Hold the toothpicks and dip frozen peanut butter balls into the melted chocolate, leaving a small portion of peanut butter showing at the top. Return to the cookie sheet, remove and discard the toothpicks, and refrigerate until ready to serve."}]

recipe_card: Chocolate Chestnut Cake
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"baking spray"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup 60% cacao bittersweet chocolate morsels (such as Ghirardelli®)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup hot brewed coffee"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large eggs, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup canola oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup sour cream, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ⅓ cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup finely chopped roasted chestnuts"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup powdered sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup salted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (3.5 ounce) cans chestnut spread"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8 ounces bittersweet chocolate, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups heavy whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons light corn syrup"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray 3 (9-inch) round cake pans with baking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Combine chocolate morsels and hot coffee in a medium bowl; let stand for 2 minutes and then stir until chocolate is melted, 1 to 2 minutes. Whisk in eggs, oil, sour cream, and vanilla until smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, salt, baking soda, and baking powder in a large bowl. Stir in egg mixture. Fold in chopped chestnuts. Divide batter evenly between prepared pans (about 2 cups per pan)."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool in pans about 10 minutes. Invert onto a wire rack and let cool completely, about 1 hour. Trim cooled cakes flat, if necessary."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Beat powdered sugar, butter, and chestnut puree in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until filling is creamy, about 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place 1 cake layer on a cardboard round cut to the same size as cake. Spread half of the filling onto the cake layer, spreading just slightly past the edge of the layer (about 1 cup). Repeat with a second cake layer and remaining filling. Top with final cake layer. Smooth excess frosting flush with the sides of the cake. Refrigerate cake until chilled, about 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place chocolate in a 4-cup glass measuring cup with a spout for the glaze; set aside. Bring cream and corn syrup to a low simmer in a small saucepan over medium-low, stirring occasionally. Pour cream mixture over chocolate, and let stand 2 minutes. Stir glaze with a spatula until completely smooth. Let stand at room temperature, stirring occasionally, until cooled to 100 to 105 degrees F (37 to 40 degrees C), 4 to 10 minutes. Glaze should be pourable and fluid."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Remove chilled cake from the refrigerator, and place on a wire rack or inverted bowl inside a rimmed baking sheet. Quickly pour glaze over top of cake, allowing glaze to flow down the sides, making sure cake is completely covered. A spoon can be used to scoop up and reuse glaze to drizzle and coat sides. Let stand for 1 minute, allowing excess glaze to drip off the sides. Run an offset spatula around bottom edge of cake to remove any drips. Chill cake until glaze is set, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"}]

recipe_card: Brownie Pie 5 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups all-purpose flour, plus more for rolling"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons ice water, or more as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"10 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large eggs, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg yolk, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons canola oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons instant espresso granules"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup chopped walnuts or hazelnuts"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup semisweet chocolate chips, divided"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"For the crust, combine flour, sugar, and teaspoon salt in a food processor and pulse about 3 times until combined. Scatter cold butter over flour mixture in food processor. Pulse about 6 times until butter resembles pea-sized pieces. Drizzle 3 tablespoons water over butter mixture. Pulse about 6 times until couscous-like beads of dough form, adding 1 more tablespoon ice water if needed."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer dough to a work surface, and press into a single mass. Shape and flatten dough into a disk."},{"recipe_directions":"Wrap in plastic wrap, and chill for at least 1 hour or up to 2 days."},{"recipe_directions":"Unwrap dough and place on a lightly floured work surface. Let dough sit at room temperature for 10 minutes to soften. Dust top of dough with flour. Using a lightly floured rolling pin, roll disk into a 12-inch circle."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place in a 9-inch pie plate, pressing into bottom and up sides of pie plate. Fold edges under, and crimp as desired. Cover with plastic wrap, and freeze for 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place parchment paper over dough in pie plate; fill with pie weights or dried beans."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until crust is starting to set, about 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Carefully remove pie plate from oven and take off parchment paper and pie weights. Return pie plate to oven, and bake until pie crust is light golden brown, 8 to 12 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer to a wire rack; let cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together melted butter, sugar, eggs, egg yolk, canola oil, and vanilla extract in a bowl until blended and smooth. Whisk in cocoa, flour, instant espresso, and salt just until combined. Stir in nuts and 1/4 cup chocolate chips."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Scrape mixture into cooled crust, and smooth top with a small offset spatula. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup chocolate chips on top of the pie."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes, covering the crust with aluminum foil if it gets too dark. Let cool 20 minutes before serving."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"}]

recipe_card: Chocolate-Covered Bacon Strips 23 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"12 slices thick-cut bacon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12 wooden skewers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup semisweet chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vegetable shortening"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Remove from oven and cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine chocolate chips and shortening in a microwave-safe bowl. recipe_card: Air Fryer Mini Dark Chocolate Cake with Brown Butter Frosting
recipe_name: Air Fryer Mini Dark Chocolate Cake with Brown Butter Frosting
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"cooking spray"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup flour, plus more for dusting cake pan"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons unsweetened Dutch process cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons low-fat buttermilk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons unsweetened applesauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 1/2 teaspoons canola oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon instant espresso coffee powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ounce dark chocolate, chopped, plus more for garnish"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5 tablespoons butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons honey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3/4 cup powdered sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons water, or as needed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat air fryer to 320 degrees F (160 degrees C). Coat a 6-inch cake pan with cooking spray. Line bottom of pan with parchment paper; dust with 2 tablespoons flour, tapping out excess."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir together 1/4 cup flour, the cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a small bowl. In another small bowl, whisk together buttermilk, applesauce, oil, espresso powder, and vanilla."},{"recipe_directions":"In a third bowl, beat egg with an electric mixer at low speed. Gradually add sugar. Increase mixer speed to high and continue beating until mixture is thick and pale, about 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Alternately fold flour mixture and buttermilk mixture into egg mixture with a rubber spatula, stirring until incorporated before adding next addition. Fold in dark chocolate."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour batter into the prepared pan. Arrange pan in the air fryer basket."},{"recipe_directions":"Cook until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Let cool in pan on a wire rack about 10 minutes. Remove cake from pan and allow to cool completely on a wire rack."},{"recipe_directions":"For the frosting, melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat; cook, stirring occasionally, until butter begins to turn golden brown and smells nutty, 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer butter to a bowl; cool for 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk in honey and vanilla. Whisk in powdered sugar until smooth, adding water, 1 teaspoon at a time, until desired consistency. The frosting will look separated but will come together with whisking in water a little at a time."},{"recipe_directions":"Immediately top cooled cake with the frosting and garnish with additional dark chocolate."}]
